author: 80raghavendra
content: <@!259648573401071617> You said you experimented with binary Merkle trees as well as hexaryfor code merkelisation. The above pointers that you gave, are for hexary. Please point to the binary ones also.

author: _drinkcoffee
content:
Some analysis (all blocks up to 10,000,000): We have identified:
272514 unique contracts on Ethereum MainNet
248974 are likely to be Solidity. That is, starts with 0x6060604052 or 0x6080604052
137553 are "new" Solidity. That is, starts with 0x6080604052
21583 are identified by aux data / meta data as have solc as the compiler
Function Id analysis:
242915 should be analysable by the function id analysis. I am working to make this number higher: the more contracts that this technique can be used with, the more relevant it is. 

NOTE: I haven't checked what proportion of modern contracts / contracts that are in use are likely to be Solidity... yet.

author: s1na
content: <@!689635476826619924> No I haven't experimented with binary yet. My binary estimates were simply assuming the transition to binary would reduce the hashes in the proof by 3x
